grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 疎【ソ】sparse, distant (of a relationship), estranged, alienated
疎開【ソカイ】dispersal, evacuation, removal, spreading out (troops), deployment
空疎【クウソ】empty (e.g. argument), insubstantial, hollow, fruitless
kun reading compounds: 疎い【うとい】distant, estranged, disinterested, poorly informed, unfamiliar, ignorant
疎む【うとむ】to shun, to avoid, to ostracize, to neglect, to distance oneself from, to give the hard shoulder
疎ら【まばら】sparse, thin, scattered, straggling, sporadic
